item.title: James M. Inhofe National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2023

latestAction.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 445.

item.title: Preserving Options for Everglades Restoration and National Defense in the Straits of Florida Act

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Armed Services.

item.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Armed Services.

summary.text:
Protecting Critical Ecosystems and Military Readiness in Florida Act

This bill prohibits the Department of the Air Force from entering into an agreement that would provide for or permit the joint use of Homestead Air Reserve Base in Homestead, Florida, by the Air Force and civil aircraft.

bill.title: Protecting Critical Ecosystems and Military Readiness in Florida Act

item.title: Protecting Critical Ecosystems and Military Readiness in Florida Act
Protecting Critical Ecosystems and Military Readiness in Florida Act

A bill to prohibit the Secretary of the Air Force from entering into an agreement that would provide for or permit the joint use of Homestead Air Reserve Base, Homestead, Florida, by the Air Force and civil aircraft.

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Armed Services.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
